instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power without ac adapter
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> light damage board arround lvds only.

With ac adapter and battery it power up.
Only with battery it power up.
Only with ac adapter (no battery) it doesnot power up and I have 12.56V, <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> - ACOK - 3.33V. Also 17,18 and 27,28 are ok at 3ohm and 20ohm in <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

If I connect battery and ac adapter and load OS X sees the battery at 61% but it keep alway at 61%. No up no down.

Any idea? Bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power without ac adapter
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power without ac adapter
threads.message:
Green light always. 12.56V always
acok at 3.3V alwaya
